item.description:
North and Middle Tripyramid via the Pine Bend Brook Trail and Mount Tripyramid Trail. This is an out-and-back, no car spot necessary.

Trail Description

Discussion of routes to the Tripyramids

Winter Hike - snowshoes and traction required. This hike may be a little longer, and require more water crossings than some easier peaks. I don't think it would be a good choice for a first-ever winter hike. Also, I have not done this route, and am depending on trail descriptions from others, so please do your own research and don't expect me to be a font of knowledge.

I hike more-or-less book time, though slower on ascents, faster on flats and descents. If particularly nasty weather or difficulties with water crossings occur, this may get cut short. The summit is optional, returning to the trailhead is mandatory.

Parking available at the trailhead, ranger says it is usually plowed out for several cars.

Trailhead:

Roadside on NH Route 112 (Kancamagus Highway) one mile W of Sabbaday Falls picnic area and county line, elevation about 1380 feet
44.0016�N, 71.4130�W (WGS84)

From Exit 32 of I-93, take NH Route 112 E over Kancamagus Pass about 19.5 miles (about 2.9 miles beyond Lily Pond), roadside parking on R

Mt Tripyramid, North Peak: elev 4180'
Mt Tripyramid, Middle Peak: elev 4140'

Total Mileage: 9.6mi RT
Total Elevation Gain: 3,450 ft
"Book" time: 6:30
item.name: North and Middle Tripyramid from the Kanc
